intro: Scrophularia versicolor, commonly known as the variable foxglove, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many species with showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring lance-shaped leaves and clusters of flowers that range in color from pink to purple. Its flowers are bilaterally symmetrical, with five petals, and are adapted for pollination by insects such as bees and butterflies. Scrophularia versicolor is often found in moist meadows and woodland edges, thriving in partial shade to full sun.
